Consider using
private static final Logger LOG = LogManager.getLogger(SqlRequest.class);

...

timeline.bodyText:
Question, what is definition sensitive data? age or 30?
IMO, the value is more sensitive than field. e.g. password = '123456', it more make sense to mask the value like password = 'xxx'

timeline.bodyText: Because values (literals) in query is more sensitive, you may need to rewrite methods like visit(SQLNumberExpr x), visit(SQLCharExpr x) etc. We can add a few UTs to cover common literals such as string, numerical, bool, datetime etc.

timeline.bodyText:
Curious what will be the output in log4j, does it output multiple line for the same query?
If so, I would suggest to remove the newline to make it in same line. Because usually, we process the log data by using line based tools and group the data with request id. e.g., grep requestId=xxx which will return all the log corresponding to specific request.
